details: Delmain is a full-service digital marketing and web design agency. Our focus is on helping dentists get more patients through their websites.*We’re looking to add a Web Designer/Developer to our growing team.**Our ideal candidate is someone who wants to continue their web design career, stay up-to-date with best practices and emerging trends, and translate client goals into visually stunning websites. This person will be a creative designer, problem solver, and collaborative member of our team.**Take ownership of 2-5 web design projects per month from conception to completionPitch work to clients, answer questions, and incorporate feedbackThink creatively and strategically about the end-to-end user experienceCreate and build wireframes to communicate design ideas to new/existing partners and internal teamsLead occasional branding projectsPerform user research and testing****Delmain is…**Focused on providing digital marketing & web design services to US-based dentists.Currently, a remote company based in Oregon. We have transitioned to remote work and do not (and do not expect to) work in a physical office environment for the foreseeable future.Run using the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS). If you’ve worked in an EOS company before, tell us about your experience in your cover letter! If you haven’t, we’ll teach you everything you need to know. EOS is built around 6 components: People, Vision, Data, Issues, Process, and Traction, and requires strong leadership and individual accountability.****Duties & responsibilities35% - Actively contribute to Delmain’s Design & Development Team. Includes daily collaboration, weekly and monthly meetings25% - Simultaneous design, development, and launch of 2-5 websites per month. This position requires significant design work in addition to project management20% - Envision and create usable, unique wireframes and ready-for-production designs based on your interpretation of the website requirements10% - Take ownership of other tasks/projects, including design strategy for all Delmain partners, branding projects, and working with outside web developers5% - Create and document processes, best practices, and standard operating procedures5% - Contribute to improving our internal quality assurance process for web design projects****Formal qualifications**2+ years professional design experience, ideally in an agency settingExperience in Figma or similar design toolIn-depth knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JS/JQuery, and WordPress — we use the Divi theme and if you have experience using it, let us know!Experience in PHP is a plus. If you have experience in developing themes or plugins, let us know!Proficiency in using cPanel and editing DNS records for hosting set up and site launchesComfortable using other CMS platforms like Squarespace and WeeblyExperience leading meetings, communicating ideas to and interfacing with partnersMastery of the Adobe Creative Suite for web design (Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign, Acrobat)Excellent organizational and project management abilitiesAbility to work in a supportive environment with little supervision while tackling several projects simultaneouslyResidence in Oregon is required**The formalities**Hours: Full-time / SalariedPaid Time OffHealth & Dental InsuranceRetirement PlanRemote Work Stipend****Working at Delmain**We take our core values seriously — they aren’t just things we say, they guide how we make decisions, interact with each other, plan our workdays, and choose the partners we work withWe balance our workload with a team-wide effort to work no more than 40 hours per weekEvery other month, we work a half-day and then enjoy a team outing. Recently, we’ve played virtual bingo together, had trivia quizzes, and went to a pumpkin patch.****Diversity & inclusionJoin us on our journey**“Diversity is counting numbers. Inclusivity is making numbers count.” - Nichole Barnes Marshall**At Delmain, we recognize we need to work on both.**We ask thoughtful questions. We learn together. We strive to be a place where every voice is heard and represented. As we grow our culture and our team, we seek to represent diverse beliefs, backgrounds, education, and skills.****How to apply**Please send a resume and cover letter to careers at delmain.co. In your cover letter briefly tell us how you align with our core values:**Curiosity – We are open to the possibility that there is a better way to do thingsNeighborly – We share in mutual communication, respect, and trustBalanced – We maintain a healthy work-life balance in all of our relationshipsPositivity – We see the best in everyone and every opportunity*Job Type: Full-timePay: $14.00 - $41.00 per hourBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insuranceRetirement planSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:We are a remote company.Work Location: Multiple Locations

details: Completes work as a full-stack developer using the .NET platform and contributes to all aspects of the software development cycle: from design and development, all the way to support and documentation. Able to work in a team environment and meet deadlines. Strong interpersonal, presentation, analytical, written, and verbal communication skills.

details: Offchain Labs is building a suite of scaling solutions for Ethereum. This includes Arbitrum, an Optimistic Rollup, that instantly scales apps, reducing costs and increasing capacity, without sacrificing Ethereum's security. Porting contracts to Arbitrum requires no code changes or downloads since it’s compatible with existing Ethereum developer languages and tooling. Our team is extremely passionate and works tirelessly to bridge the gap between what blockchain is and what blockchain can be. We strive to maintain an atmosphere that fosters innovation and new ideas through collaboration, research, and deep discussions. After raising an initial round of $3.8M in seed funding in January 2019 and a $20M series A, as well as a $100M series B in 2021, we are ready to hire additional team members that have an interest in working in the blockchain space and a knack for approaching problems in unconventional ways. Who you are: Excited to learn and develop blockchain technology (No experience yet? No problem!) Expert in Front-end development Experience with React.js, CSS3, Typescript, Javascript Bonus: Solidity Possess a strong sense of ownership in your work, which drives you to find ways to do things better and faster Always up-to-speed on the latest technologies Constantly on the lookout for new and innovative ways to solve complex problems through rigorous experimentation Your communication style is open, transparent, and direct, and you consistently work in tight collaboration with your teammates Always open to feedback, new ideas, and opportunities for self-improvement You look for ways to help out beyond the scope of your day-to-day work What you've done: Have dabbled in, educated yourself on, or are experienced working on blockchain technology Eager to bring cutting-edge research to the real world and help build a platform for the next generation of cryptocurrency applications Security-minded and always keeping an eye out for potential threats and vulnerabilities in your code Mastered CS fundamentals, either in a formal university program or through self-learning We understand it takes a diverse team of highly intelligent, passionate, curious, and creative people to solve the challenges involved in developing and improving Arbitrum. Our dynamic team has incredible perspectives to share, just as we know you do. We take great pride in being an equal opportunity workplace.

details: The Front End Developer will take their passion for digital usability, design and web development to create world class experiences for Dollar Tree & Family Dollar customers who interact with the brand via various digital means. The Front End Developer’s main role is to work with various internal and external stakeholders to capture business requirements, visions, and insights and then to transform them into scalable dynamic digital experiences. The Front End Developer will collaborate with both company management as well as with external vendor partners to design and develop these digital and web applications. The Front End Developer will also play a role in developing the knowledge, understanding and underlying skill sets of any Interface Designers/Web Developers working in the Digital Division of Dollar Tree, Inc. Provide technical Leadership for all aspects of Dollar Tree’s Ecommerce sites, Non-Ecommerce sites, Local Store Websites, Call Center application. Work closely with graphic designers to create, schedule and launch various on-site and off-site promotional campaigns (i.e. Content Pages, Banner Ads, and Emails). Work closely and collaboratively with the company’s IS department to ensure all company standards, policies and process requirements are met and maintained. Assist in managing relationships with various technical partners & vendors as needed. Monitor site performance across a variety of metrics (i.e. load time, up-time, performance across browsers, click through pathing, conversion, abandonment, etc.). Perform expert reviews on concepts and wire frames and integrate this into the design process on an iterative basis by presenting the findings and suggesting changes where necessary. Serve as Primary technical contact for partners and vendors in terms of integrations, configurations, maintenance, enhancements, launches and fixes. Accountable for making sound recommendations on the navigation, functionality, organizational structure, page-to-page flow and design of ecommerce and non ecommerce web sites. Translate strategy, business requirements, consumer research findings and usability/design best practices into site design solutions that balance the best user experience while delivering on business goals. Work closely with Dollar Tree Direct Upper Management to ensure auditable systems are in place and maintained to ensure compliance from both a legal and an auditing perspective. Play the Leader’s role in the monitoring, tracking, fixing and testing of enhancements and bug fixes. Support Call Center efforts, looking for process flow improvements made possible by improving Interfaces and Work Flows. Prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and produce quality work in a fast-paced environment. Pin-point important issues that may require further discovery research. Design user interaction solutions/schematics based on sound usability principles, research and technical feasibility. Express these solutions through design documents. These documents may include architecture-maps, system process flows and thumbnail flows. Minimum Requirements/Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (EX: BS – Information Technology) plus a minimum of 3 years of interface design including site development and adaptation for established, consumer facing web sites. A minimum of 3 years of experience in each of the following technologies: HTML/CSS/JavaScript A minimum of 3 years of Web programming/Computer logic experience A minimum of 1 years of experience in XML A minimum of 1 years of front-end technologies (Web Developer Suite) to include Dreamweaver and PhotoShop A minimum if 3 years of experience and proven success in implementing usability testing practices and then implementing deliverables based of those outputs A thorough and deep intellectual understanding of common web and interface conventions, as well as dynamic, data-driven web sites. Strong understanding of various Web browser platforms (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Internet Explorer), and the impact/variations they can have on such things as usability, load times, and renderings A proven track record of Project Management is necessary as is the ability to play roles in multiple projects in a fast paced environment with a focus on delivery world class outputs/deliverables Must be able to translate business strategies into conceptual diagrams, task flows, and site maps A strong working knowledge SEO best practices as well as experience in SEO analytics Knowledge and understanding of the importance of marketing and online branding Detail oriented with excellent organization, analytical, technical writing and problem-solving skills. Must be fully vaccinated from COVID-19, as defined by the CDC, by the date of hire. Proof of vaccination required. Request for medical or religious accommodation must be made prior to the start date Desired Qualifications Strong understanding and track record of coding to WAG and ADA Accessibility standards

details: Company Description Hi there! We’re Razorfish. We’ve been leading the marketing industry with our digital expertise since the start of the internet. But in 2020, we did a full reboot. What’s different? It all starts with people. Weird, wonderful, complex people -with diverse backgrounds in strategy, creative and technology. But no matter how different we are, we all have one thing in common. We believe our differences are our strength. So we push for inclusion, challenge convention and bring in new perspectives, to inspire new ideas. Because when we connect by understanding what makes people different, we can create unforgettable experiences that enrich lives. Join us at razorfish.com. Job Description PLEASE NOTE: This is NOT a remote position and all candidates must be local to Seattle to receive consideration. Some onsite work at our lab in Seattle will be required. Razorfish is looking for a Developer... but not just ANY Developer. We are looking for someone who spent their college days behind the desk at the Apple Genius Bar or driving around one of those snazzy Geek Squad vans. Someone whose weekends are filled with tweaking their personal laptop, developing video games with friends, or building and optimizing their personal Raspberry Pi server. Someone with a natural curiosity who loves solving puzzles and is passionate about all things tech. Professionally, you are fundamentally a Developer. You lean towards the front-end side because you are naturally creative and love building things that people actually interact with but you also have an understanding of what is going on behind the scenes and may even know some .NET or Node. You know JavaScript and have worked in frameworks like React and Ember, but you're also interested in modern technologies like AR/VR and AWS Cloud; you have maybe even dabbled in tools like Unity and Unreal Engine. You love collaborating, ideating, and learning and you're constantly pushing yourself to expand your knowledge of all things tech, both at work and at home. Your dream job would be to spend 75% of the day coding and developing modern, stylish customer-facing interactive experiences and the other 25% playing around under the hood of computers and related hardware, installing, upgrading, configuring, and tinkering. This is a growth role so the core skillset can be flexible... but a drive, passion, and love for technology is not. If that all sounds like you, then let's talk. Qualifications Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, graduation from a relevant bootcamp, or equivalent experience/certifications 6+ months of prior professional development experience Side passion projects or prior jobs in the tech space (developing video games, working on a tech support team, building websites, blogging about technology, etc.) Experience developing using modern JavaScript frameworks such as React or Ember Familiarity or experience with Node, .NET, or other backend languages Familiarity with AWS and other cloud technologies as well as a basic understanding on setup and configuration Experience troubleshooting, updating, installing, and repairing computers, servers, cameras, displays, LEDs, and related hardware and peripherals Extraordinary attention to detail Excellent communication skills and a love of collaboration Passion for technology, a natural curiosity, and a love of problem-solving A desire to learn, grow, and be mentored Additional Information As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Sapient Corporation is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.
